intro: Ichnanthus glaberrimus, commonly known as the smooth rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Ichnanthus glaberrimus is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and is often found in nutrient-rich soils.
